commit_message:
Catch InstanceNotFound in instance_actions GET

Catch the InstanceNotFound exception in the instance_actions
index function and handle the error gracefully so a stacktrace is
not generated in the log files. This patch does not change the
API

Fixes bug 1182867

Change-Id: I0764f8abda7176deefe0d103bd86acd0af78780d

subject: Accept env variables to override default passwords
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-21 16:31:28.000000000', 'files': ['tools/sample_data.sh'], 'message': 'Accept env variables to override default passwords

Preserves the default passwords corresponding to the OpenStack Install
and Deploy Manual while allowing environment variables to specify user
provided passwords. As well, a single common password for all the service
users can be specified using the SERVICE_PASSWORD environment variable.

This fix restores compatibility with the version of this script released
in Folsom where the environment variables could override default passwords.
It also preserves compatibility with the fix for bug 1073291 that brought
the script into line with the docs (but unfortunately broke backwards
compatibility).

There is no warning emited if the user does not override the default
passwords as was present in Folsom, but not in Grizzly. This makes the
fix output compatible with Grizzly only. Note that the logic for warnings
pre-Grizzly was unclear. The script is, however, clearly named "sample"
and warnings are present in the comments.

Change-Id: I927fcddf04dcb87e5c9252f0874939b17f3c4809
Fixes: bug #1166182
'}]
commit_message:
Accept env variables to override default passwords

Preserves the default passwords corresponding to the OpenStack Install
and Deploy Manual while allowing environment variables to specify user
provided passwords. As well, a single common password for all the service
users can be specified using the SERVICE_PASSWORD environment variable.

This fix restores compatibility with the version of this script released
in Folsom where the environment variables could override default passwords.
It also preserves compatibility with the fix for bug 1073291 that brought
the script into line with the docs (but unfortunately broke backwards
compatibility).

There is no warning emited if the user does not override the default
passwords as was present in Folsom, but not in Grizzly. This makes the
fix output compatible with Grizzly only. Note that the logic for warnings
pre-Grizzly was unclear. The script is, however, clearly named "sample"
and warnings are present in the comments.

Change-Id: I927fcddf04dcb87e5c9252f0874939b17f3c4809
Fixes: bug #1166182

commit_message:
Add msgpack as a dependency

Ceilometer will use msgpack for encoding data in, at least, its UDP
based transport.

msgpack is distributed under the Apache Software License. It seems to
support Python 3, and is already packaged for Debian, Ubuntu, Fedora,
and probably a lot more OSes.

Change-Id: I35ceb44046fe3faaa7aebf9a6e1f173acc7b1c02
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Reuse oslo for is_uuid_like() implementation

In the original code, isalnum() in is_uuid_like() doesn't allow "-",
while for UUID, format like aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaaa should be
allowed. This patch is to reuse uuidutils's API in oslo.

Change-Id: I339974c75a32d27f8e4443a1b97bb6e410933aa4
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1711, 'name': 'Yun Mao', 'email': 'yunmao@gmail.com', 'username': 'yunmao'}, {'_account_id': 1865, 'name': 'Andrea Rosa', 'email': 'andrea.rosa@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-rosa-m'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7133, 'name': 'Ryan Moore', 'email': 'ryan.moore@hpe.com', 'username': 'moory'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-21 10:31:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/test_filter_scheduler.py', 'nova/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'set ERROR state when scheduler hits max attempts

Presently when scheduler raises NoValidHost due to max attempts
being reached, the instance remains in a build state.
Exception handler for NoValidHost in manager.run_instance() needs
request_spec[instance_uuids] to know which host to put into an
error state in _set_vm_state_and_notify().
schedule_run_instances() was popping instance_uuids from the
request_spec prior to a call to _schedule().
Changed pop of instance_uuids prior to call to _schedule() to be a get.
Added pop of instance_uuids to beneath call to _schedule() as
individual creates do not need them.

Change-Id: I9654820e01d5611763e9e673f15f46b947d09e6d
Fixes: bug #1182056
'}]
commit_message:
set ERROR state when scheduler hits max attempts

Presently when scheduler raises NoValidHost due to max attempts
being reached, the instance remains in a build state.
Exception handler for NoValidHost in manager.run_instance() needs
request_spec[instance_uuids] to know which host to put into an
error state in _set_vm_state_and_notify().
schedule_run_instances() was popping instance_uuids from the
request_spec prior to a call to _schedule().
Changed pop of instance_uuids prior to call to _schedule() to be a get.
Added pop of instance_uuids to beneath call to _schedule() as
individual creates do not need them.

Change-Id: I9654820e01d5611763e9e673f15f46b947d09e6d
Fixes: bug #1182056

subject: Don't update API cell on get_nwinfo
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-22 06:09:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/api.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_messaging.py', 'nova/cells/messaging.py', 'nova/db/api.py'], 'message': "Don't update API cell on get_nwinfo

Every call to get_instance_nw_info() updates an instance's info_cache.
The purpose of this is to make sure we're constantly healing the
info_cache table.  However, this causes a lot of unneeded updates
traveling up to the API cell.  Cells has its own periodic task that
heals all instance data.

Fixes bug 1180304

Change-Id: I07774712a6358999fd1fdd0f5a90c6f05e3d8d6e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't update API cell on get_nwinfo

Every call to get_instance_nw_info() updates an instance's info_cache.
The purpose of this is to make sure we're constantly healing the
info_cache table.  However, this causes a lot of unneeded updates
traveling up to the API cell.  Cells has its own periodic task that
heals all instance data.

Fixes bug 1180304

Change-Id: I07774712a6358999fd1fdd0f5a90c6f05e3d8d6e

commit_message:
Remove unrelated tracebacks from test output

This mocks some calls the ThreadGroup when testing update and delete of
the stack, resulting in tracebacks when the threads randomly run later
on in the test suite.

Change-Id: Ia1a376933c2e25b6cf0fe6a26f47e381cbb1a55e
Fixes: bug #1182285

subject: Remove glance-control from the test suite
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2013-05-21 19:52:47.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/test_bin_glance_control.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_multiprocessing.py', 'glance/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_glance_manage.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/tests/utils.py'], 'message': 'Remove glance-control from the test suite

This patch removes the use of glance-control from the test suite. Instead
of forking out glance-control and letting it fork out the other programs,
we will now fork out the other programs directly. The file which tested
glance-control has also been removed. While we will still have
glance-control as part of the distribution for a bit and thus it should
still be tested, that test was doing so in a way that depended upon the
forking behavior previously found in the test suite.

This patch also requires the patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26076/ on which it is dependent. As a
side effect it tests for the problem found in bug: 1068051

Additionally, this fixes a race condition. Previously each functional
test called cleanup() in tearDown(). Cleanup would open a pid file and
send a SIGTERM to the processes (api, registry, scrubber). However,
it did not wait for this process to die and get cleaned up. The signal
handler in the processes is over ridden so the death is not instant.
This leaves a chance for server from a previous test to be actively
listening on a port when the next test starts.

fixes bug: 1173415
blueprint: refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: Iabdb6fdc13b5f1993590b5a801a0e89df1a544c7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove glance-control from the test suite

This patch removes the use of glance-control from the test suite. Instead
of forking out glance-control and letting it fork out the other programs,
we will now fork out the other programs directly. The file which tested
glance-control has also been removed. While we will still have
glance-control as part of the distribution for a bit and thus it should
still be tested, that test was doing so in a way that depended upon the
forking behavior previously found in the test suite.

This patch also requires the patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26076/ on which it is dependent. As a
side effect it tests for the problem found in bug: 1068051

Additionally, this fixes a race condition. Previously each functional
test called cleanup() in tearDown(). Cleanup would open a pid file and
send a SIGTERM to the processes (api, registry, scrubber). However,
it did not wait for this process to die and get cleaned up. The signal
handler in the processes is over ridden so the death is not instant.
This leaves a chance for server from a previous test to be actively
listening on a port when the next test starts.

fixes bug: 1173415
blueprint: refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: Iabdb6fdc13b5f1993590b5a801a0e89df1a544c7

subject: Avoid error 414 when retrieving subnet cidrs for ListNetworks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-22 08:58:37.000000000', 'files': ['quantumclient/v2_0/client.py', 'tests/unit/test_cli20_network.py', 'quantumclient/common/exceptions.py', 'quantumclient/quantum/v2_0/network.py', 'quantumclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Avoid error 414 when retrieving subnet cidrs for ListNetworks

Bug 1172537

In order to avoif 414 the list subnet requests will be split in
multiple requests. The total URI len for each of these requests
will be lower than 8K (the default maximum for eventlet.wsgi.server).
The patch tries to submit a single request, and if the URI is too
long an exception is raised before the request is sent over the
wire; the exception handler will split the subnet id list, and
submit the new requests.

This patch does not address the case in which the server is
configured with a maximum URI length different from 8K.

Change-Id: Ia2414cd5374a91d3d12215807037a5d46b836ad6
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid error 414 when retrieving subnet cidrs for ListNetworks

Bug 1172537

In order to avoif 414 the list subnet requests will be split in
multiple requests. The total URI len for each of these requests
will be lower than 8K (the default maximum for eventlet.wsgi.server).
The patch tries to submit a single request, and if the URI is too
long an exception is raised before the request is sent over the
wire; the exception handler will split the subnet id list, and
submit the new requests.

This patch does not address the case in which the server is
configured with a maximum URI length different from 8K.

Change-Id: Ia2414cd5374a91d3d12215807037a5d46b836ad6

subject: Shows a warning message when deleting a container that contains data.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-19 10:44:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/swift.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/containers/tests.py'], 'message': 'Shows a warning message when deleting a container that contains data.

We cannot delete objects in the container since there may be millions
of objects in that. The batch deletion should be done in swift instead
of Horizon. The batch remove of objects function is only in swift CLI
command now. This commit replace the unclear message with a warning
message that tells the user the container is not empy.

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1034890

Fixes bug: #1096084

Change-Id: I59b46a3535b8654734c3dae4eec916ab1b53c716
'}]
commit_message:
Shows a warning message when deleting a container that contains data.

We cannot delete objects in the container since there may be millions
of objects in that. The batch deletion should be done in swift instead
of Horizon. The batch remove of objects function is only in swift CLI
command now. This commit replace the unclear message with a warning
message that tells the user the container is not empy.

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1034890

Fixes bug: #1096084

Change-Id: I59b46a3535b8654734c3dae4eec916ab1b53c716

commit_message:
Log a warning if dnsmasq version is below the minimum required

It has been noted that older versions of dnsmasq may have unexpected
behavior, so this patch introduces a check on dnsmasq version; if
the minimum version is not met, a warning is logged. This is less
invasive than raising an Exception and abort the dhcp agent, even
though this also seems like a perfectly acceptable behavior.

Fixes bug 1170793

(cherry picked from commit 364032897293256436647cb89c61a3dffb408946)

Aforementioned cherry-pick has sudo issues hence the additional one
(cherry picked from commit 91b56e41eecf2cd8b4c848b4e773a1be307b40c3)

Change-Id: I8475afc6bdd6145d2a491177af080fee960cb3e6

We currently allow just one name/group for deprecation. For adoption
of oslo db by multiple projects, we need to be able to specify

For example connection is defined as follows in various

commit_message:
Allow Multiple sets of deprecated name/group for options

We currently allow just one name/group for deprecation. For adoption
of oslo db by multiple projects, we need to be able to specify
multiple sets of deprecated name/group.

For example connection is defined as follows in various
projects and we need to be able specify all the combinations
for being able to upgrade from Grizzly to Havana

Nova: Section - DEFAULT; Key - sql_connection
Cinder: Section - DEFAULT; Key - sql_connection
Glance: Section - DEFAULT; Key - sql_connection
Quantum: Section - DATABASE; key - sql_connection
Keystone: Section - SQL; key - connection

Please see discussion on the dev mailing list and on the
review - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27345 for
oslo-incubator

Change-Id: I8c2097275242a4fdbd4f0f9fb4e293d1ba793d16

(None is not iterable)

commit_message:
Fix resize when instance has no image

This patch makes it possible to resize an instance that has no image
supplied (was booted from volume), by avoiding calling the image service
and thus causing an uncaught exception, if there was no image suplied in
the first place.

Fixes bug: 1182114
blueprint: improve-boot-from-volume

Change-Id: I67d63a7aef699b555897582c74b04e857db7aafb

commit_message:
Make discovery of version for KS catalog smarter.

Instead of relying on the configuration file for determining how
the catalog should be parsed, make it flexible by inspecting the
structure of the service catalog passed to it.

Fixes bug 1180486

Change-Id: I0c8caf4c8365bf25377ab3a249ac280d8add0f17

commit_message:
parse_isotime filter to parse a date string.

This then allows the resulting date value to be piped
to one of the standard django date/time format filters

This is identical to oslo timeutils parse_isotime, but annotated with
@register.filter

Required for blueprint: heat-ui

Change-Id: Ibecca77d50bb5c0df59e07e9572069215229f60a

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-22 06:51:45.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/tests/unit/cisco/test_network_plugin.py', 'quantum/plugins/cisco/nexus/cisco_nexus_network_driver_v2.py', 'quantum/plugins/cisco/nexus/cisco_nexus_snippets.py'], 'message': 'Fix Cisco Nexus plugin failures for vlan IDs 1006-4094

Fixes bug 1174593

VLAN IDs in the range 1006-4094 are considered to be in the extended
range by the Cisco Nexus 3K switch. As such, the 3K rejects any
state change configuration commands for VLANs in this range, including
"state active" and "no shutdown". The errors returned by the 3K for
these commands can be ignored, since the default states for these commands
are acceptable for the 3K.

For the 5K and 7K versions of the Nexus switch, on the other hand, the
"state active" and "no shutdown" commands are required for proper VLAN
configuration, regardless of VLAN ID.

This fix splits the configuration commands which are used to create a
VLAN on the Nexus switch into three separate configurations:
  - VLAN creation
  - state active
  - no shutdown
For the "state active" and "no shutdown" configurations, the Cisco Nexus
plugin will tolerate (ignore) errors involving invalid setting of state
for VLANs in the extended VLAN range. These specific errors can be
identified by looking for the appearance of certain signature strings
in the associated exception's message string, i.e. "Can't modify
state for extended" or "Command is allowed on VLAN".

This approach will yield a very small hit in performance, but the solution
is much less error prone than requiring customers to configure the
Cisco plugin for 3K vs. 5K vs. 7K, or perhaps even specific software
versions of the 3K, in order to inform the Cisco plugin whether
VLAN state configuration commands should be used or not.

Change-Id: I1be4966ddc6f462bca38428c4f904f8c982f318f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Cisco Nexus plugin failures for vlan IDs 1006-4094

Fixes bug 1174593

VLAN IDs in the range 1006-4094 are considered to be in the extended
range by the Cisco Nexus 3K switch. As such, the 3K rejects any
state change configuration commands for VLANs in this range, including
"state active" and "no shutdown". The errors returned by the 3K for
these commands can be ignored, since the default states for these commands
are acceptable for the 3K.

For the 5K and 7K versions of the Nexus switch, on the other hand, the
"state active" and "no shutdown" commands are required for proper VLAN
configuration, regardless of VLAN ID.

This fix splits the configuration commands which are used to create a
VLAN on the Nexus switch into three separate configurations:
  - VLAN creation
  - state active
  - no shutdown
For the "state active" and "no shutdown" configurations, the Cisco Nexus
plugin will tolerate (ignore) errors involving invalid setting of state
for VLANs in the extended VLAN range. These specific errors can be
identified by looking for the appearance of certain signature strings
in the associated exception's message string, i.e. "Can't modify
state for extended" or "Command is allowed on VLAN".

This approach will yield a very small hit in performance, but the solution
is much less error prone than requiring customers to configure the
Cisco plugin for 3K vs. 5K vs. 7K, or perhaps even specific software
versions of the 3K, in order to inform the Cisco plugin whether
VLAN state configuration commands should be used or not.

Change-Id: I1be4966ddc6f462bca38428c4f904f8c982f318f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-21 13:35:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'Support mount options for NFS/GlusterFS volumes

This patch adds support for mount options for NFS/GlusterFS volumes.

To set options, append them to the line for the volume in the
nfs_shares_config or glusterfs_shares_config file:
 192.168.175.166:/testvol -o backupvolfile-server=192.168.175.177
 host1:/testvol2 -o backupvolfile-server=host2,rw,other_option

These options are used when mounting from the cinder-volume
service and the nova-compute service.  (There is an associated
nova-compute patch to enable the same.)

This is a useful change for GlusterFS because the
backupvolfile-server option enables a mount to succeed even if
the first server specified is offline.

Change-Id: I13bb0a930d6a05e803ccb50e6dc5d4b2b412ac11
'}]
commit_message:
Support mount options for NFS/GlusterFS volumes

This patch adds support for mount options for NFS/GlusterFS volumes.

To set options, append them to the line for the volume in the
nfs_shares_config or glusterfs_shares_config file:
 192.168.175.166:/testvol -o backupvolfile-server=192.168.175.177
 host1:/testvol2 -o backupvolfile-server=host2,rw,other_option

These options are used when mounting from the cinder-volume
service and the nova-compute service.  (There is an associated
nova-compute patch to enable the same.)

This is a useful change for GlusterFS because the
backupvolfile-server option enables a mount to succeed even if
the first server specified is offline.

Change-Id: I13bb0a930d6a05e803ccb50e6dc5d4b2b412ac11

commit_message:
Added verification for libvirt availability in driver.

  Added check for libvirt connection availability in
  nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver.destroy method, which
  raises new LibvirtNotAvailableException.

  Also in nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager._delete_instance
  added except block for LibvirtNotAvailableException, where
  instance's status in setted to 'error'.

  If libvirt service is unavailable and user wants to terminate
  an instance the instance gets vm_status 'error' instead of
  infinite task_status 'deleting' and vm_status 'active'.

  Fixes LP bug #966087

Change-Id: I80ec5c68946deed60f2091ac6025028899f1f991

As instances are soft deleted, instance data may still be
    available in the database. This feature allows users to
    retrieve this data if it's available. As it is implemented
    as a policy, it can be restricted to only certain users/roles.

When enabled, a show call on a deleted instance will return
    what data is available instead of a 404 Not Found. If the
    soft deleted data is purged from the database, a 404 Not Found
    will be returned to the user.

Change-Id: If9e1f2fe1d7d7691a13aaa0d7c45dc126bee64c7
"}]
commit_message:
Add policy to enable showing of deleted instances

As instances are soft deleted, instance data may still be
    available in the database. This feature allows users to
    retrieve this data if it's available. As it is implemented
    as a policy, it can be restricted to only certain users/roles.

When enabled, a show call on a deleted instance will return
    what data is available instead of a 404 Not Found. If the
    soft deleted data is purged from the database, a 404 Not Found
    will be returned to the user.

When disabled, a show call on a deleted instance will maintain
    it's normal behavior, thus returning a 404 Not Found.

DocImpact

Implements bp show-deleted-instances

Change-Id: If9e1f2fe1d7d7691a13aaa0d7c45dc126bee64c7

subject: Added region affinity to proxy server
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-10 17:01:32.000000000', 'files': ['etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'swift/proxy/server.py'], 'message': 'Added region affinity to proxy server

The proxy server now is made aware of its location by the configuration
setting "region" if this is not set changes dont affect the behaviour.
The affinity is useful for when two regions exist which have a high latency.
When the region is set to "2", the proxy pushes all nodes which are in the
region 2 to the top and are thus tried first.

Usecase:
Region 1: Asia
Region 2: Europe
Proxy in Europe

Default behaviour is that a random node is selected. Thus sometimes the
proxy selects the asian server. This causes latencies and not needed inter-
continental traffic.

Change-Id: I851b5dc12b9d7895635f5d53dd5b023737bded7b
'}]
commit_message:
Added region affinity to proxy server

The proxy server now is made aware of its location by the configuration
setting "region" if this is not set changes dont affect the behaviour.
The affinity is useful for when two regions exist which have a high latency.
When the region is set to "2", the proxy pushes all nodes which are in the
region 2 to the top and are thus tried first.

Usecase:
Region 1: Asia
Region 2: Europe
Proxy in Europe

Default behaviour is that a random node is selected. Thus sometimes the
proxy selects the asian server. This causes latencies and not needed inter-
continental traffic.

Change-Id: I851b5dc12b9d7895635f5d53dd5b023737bded7b

commit_message:
DB md5-collide

Test against hash collide for Containers and Accounts
Store the account and container name in the extended attributes of
the DB file.

Also remove some redundent calls to os.path.exists()

Change-Id: I7c1dc7139ce8fa0c31a0c74951383a7432791af0
Fix: Bug #1158661

subject: Hide db_file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4108, 'name': 'David Hadas', 'email': 'davidh@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'david-hadas'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}, {'_account_id': 6493, 'name': 'John Bresnahan', 'email': 'john@bresnahan.me', 'username': 'jbresnah'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-05-08 04:33:10.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'swift/account/auditor.py', 'swift/container/sync.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sync.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db.py', 'swift/account/server.py'], 'message': 'Hide db_file

This started as a small re-importation from the "big" LFS into the
DB broker level. Note that the existing GlusterFS UFO code does
not need this, because its initialize() is empty. So the checks
fail all over the place silently. However, when I wrote a "posix fs"
stub plugin, I had containers as directories and thus did not have
the "db_file". Also, I ran the tests which split the difference
between 204 and 201 being returned.

This version of the patch switches db_file to _db_file to illustrate
its "internal" nature. However, this seems like opening a whole
bunch of questions like what to do with db_type?

The .is_good() wrapper is simply called .exists() in a parallel
patch for MD5 deconflicting. We kept this as it seems a better fit.

This patch does NOT do anything about _get_xxxx_brocker(), because
it does not buy us much. If it were possible to get rid of it, then
it would be good, but as it is, GlusterFS relies on it to hook.
Therefore it seems pointless to attack it. The best we could do
is to make it an empty trampoline to the broker.

Change-Id: I34219248070d427b81834c60c7d4c054cfcc7f89
'}]
commit_message:
Hide db_file

This started as a small re-importation from the "big" LFS into the
DB broker level. Note that the existing GlusterFS UFO code does
not need this, because its initialize() is empty. So the checks
fail all over the place silently. However, when I wrote a "posix fs"
stub plugin, I had containers as directories and thus did not have
the "db_file". Also, I ran the tests which split the difference
between 204 and 201 being returned.

This version of the patch switches db_file to _db_file to illustrate
its "internal" nature. However, this seems like opening a whole
bunch of questions like what to do with db_type?

The .is_good() wrapper is simply called .exists() in a parallel
patch for MD5 deconflicting. We kept this as it seems a better fit.

This patch does NOT do anything about _get_xxxx_brocker(), because
it does not buy us much. If it were possible to get rid of it, then
it would be good, but as it is, GlusterFS relies on it to hook.
Therefore it seems pointless to attack it. The best we could do
is to make it an empty trampoline to the broker.

Change-Id: I34219248070d427b81834c60c7d4c054cfcc7f89

commit_message:
snapshot keep in saving status after instance deleted

The snapshot would always be in the queued or SAVING status
after the VM is deleted or nova compute service is shutdown.
So I combined the review comments from the code review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24820 and review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236, adding an error status
for image in glance, and make Nova to update the glance image
status via python-glanceclient.

For this fix, I submited other two code reviews in Nova and
Glance project below.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26943/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236/

resolve bug 1143659
resolve bug 1064386

Change-Id: Ib31b89c954eddfe91ca73240af8926bda386e756

commit_message:
Reference AGENT OptGoup names in lowercase

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.
Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'AGENT' references to 'agent'

Change-Id: Ie4f9957b4b33cea6ac22d5edbe3147c3f11f4443

subject: Adds iniset to lowercase 'agent' group in quantum conf files
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-21 01:50:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/quantum', 'lib/quantum_plugins/openvswitch'], 'message': "Adds iniset to lowercase 'agent' group in quantum conf files

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.

Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

In the process of switching option group names to lowercase in Quantum,
we've confronted a chicken egg problem where root_helper is defined in 'agent'
but devstack executes iniset root_helper on 'AGENT'.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29738/

To have the above patch merge, there are two options,
1) Have oslo.config be case insensitive to group names.
2) Add a iniset to 'agent' in devstack while keeping iniset on 'AGENT'
   until above patch merges.

Option 1) is not possible since oslo.config is fixed to v1.1.0 and cores
only wish to have backward compatibility on conf files and not on how we
reference the option group in the code.
Option 2) seems to be the only solution to have review 29738 pass while
keeping compatibility with other quantum patches for the time being.

Therefore this patch adds an iniset on 'agent' above each iniset on 'AGENT'

Change-Id: I233e1a4f61aafe6c6070165f88006f06b1ad5ad5
"}]
commit_message:
Adds iniset to lowercase 'agent' group in quantum conf files

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.

Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

In the process of switching option group names to lowercase in Quantum,
we've confronted a chicken egg problem where root_helper is defined in 'agent'
but devstack executes iniset root_helper on 'AGENT'.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29738/

To have the above patch merge, there are two options,
1) Have oslo.config be case insensitive to group names.
2) Add a iniset to 'agent' in devstack while keeping iniset on 'AGENT'
   until above patch merges.

Option 1) is not possible since oslo.config is fixed to v1.1.0 and cores
only wish to have backward compatibility on conf files and not on how we
reference the option group in the code.
Option 2) seems to be the only solution to have review 29738 pass while
keeping compatibility with other quantum patches for the time being.

Therefore this patch adds an iniset on 'agent' above each iniset on 'AGENT'

Change-Id: I233e1a4f61aafe6c6070165f88006f06b1ad5ad5

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary tags/attributes from our tests

Remove the following tags/attributes from our tests:
S3, EC2, slow, bug=lp912922, bug='lp1170718',
category='server-addresses', category='live-migration',
nagative, type='regression'

Now, we are left with:

Tag                   Total # of instances
--------------------  --------------------
'NO TAG'              192
gate                  62
negative              172
positive              110
smoke                 89
whitebox              2

Attribute             Total # of instances
--------------------  --------------------
type                  408

Change-Id: Idab48a7e1a53a3d64fb57ae3cd3975d665180aeb

commit_message:
Move tests into cinderclient package.

tests/__init__.py implies a package in the global namespace called
tests. That's not what these are - they're tests in the cinderclient
namespace.

Change-Id: I29c95bcd8747c3f5f21d5d900879c9b6b1c9a963

commit_message:
Reference OVS OptGoup names in lowercase

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.
Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'OVS' references to 'ovs'

Change-Id: Id8697138d822e331a6776f847915c61b40f8dd6a

commit_message:
Rename iface -> port, and restructure node.

Rename "iface" to "port" in the DB models and exceptions.
Restructure the "node" table based on API discussion in review 29867.
Make some changes to the v1 api (still more to do).

Update unit tests based on the above changes.

Change-Id: If5e0ff856424255a5e1ebcb134d262c91845fa26

commit_message:
Specify database group instead of DEFAULT

At the request of Quantum folks, Let us switch from DEFAULT to
database for the database related options. This will help with
migration etc.

DocImpact

Fixes LP# 1171837

subject: Reverse path SNAT for DNAT floating-ip.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-20 20:35:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': 'Reverse path SNAT for DNAT floating-ip.

This patch applies a reverse SNAT rule to allow instances that have an
assigned floating IP to communicate with other instances in the same
OpenStack deployment, security group rules permitting. The patch
allows members of the same private network to communicate with each
other using their floating-ips in a more consistent fashion. The rule
also addresses the situation where the target is on another private
network.

This will only work for interaction between two servers that both have
floating IPs assigned to them.

Specifically, this patch solves the problem where a target server
"sees" the private address of the client. By SNAT'ing to the client's
floating-IP, the "sees" the correct reply address and the reverse
route follows the same path that an actual external connection would
take. The SNAT ONLY occurs if a DNAT occurred before hand, allowing
communication on private networks using private IPs to remain fully
private and internal. The limitation is of course if a DNAT occurs for
other reasons, there may be issues.

Resolves bug 1178745

Change-Id: I55b7131cff5fd5a2ebf826945370d4d550e74136
(cherry picked from commit 314c419323ddd512babc4504ef8a4be1e04f2af7)
'}]
commit_message:
Reverse path SNAT for DNAT floating-ip.

This patch applies a reverse SNAT rule to allow instances that have an
assigned floating IP to communicate with other instances in the same
OpenStack deployment, security group rules permitting. The patch
allows members of the same private network to communicate with each
other using their floating-ips in a more consistent fashion. The rule
also addresses the situation where the target is on another private
network.

This will only work for interaction between two servers that both have
floating IPs assigned to them.

Specifically, this patch solves the problem where a target server
"sees" the private address of the client. By SNAT'ing to the client's
floating-IP, the "sees" the correct reply address and the reverse
route follows the same path that an actual external connection would
take. The SNAT ONLY occurs if a DNAT occurred before hand, allowing
communication on private networks using private IPs to remain fully
private and internal. The limitation is of course if a DNAT occurs for
other reasons, there may be issues.

Resolves bug 1178745

Change-Id: I55b7131cff5fd5a2ebf826945370d4d550e74136
(cherry picked from commit 314c419323ddd512babc4504ef8a4be1e04f2af7)

subject: Fix ValueError from handoff logging.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2696, 'name': 'Darrell Bishop', 'email': 'dbishop@nvidia.com', 'username': 'darrellb'}, {'_account_id': 2828, 'name': 'Michael Barton', 'email': 'mike@weirdlooking.com', 'username': 'redbo'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-05-21 20:23:04.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Fix ValueError from handoff logging.

If you have StatsD logging turned on, then the iterator returned by
Ring.get_part_nodes() will emit StatsD packets when it yields a
handoff node. That network IO may make eventlet trampoline to another
greenthread before returning from next(). Now, if that other
greenthread tries to call next() on that same iterator, it blows up
with a ValueError.

Any socket IO inside a generator's next() method can cause this. It's
easiest to reproduce with StatsD logging turned on, but logging to
syslog can trigger it too.

You can see this happen sometimes in the proxy's make_requests method
if two of the primary nodes are down. Greenthread A goes into next()
to get a handoff node, then sends a StatsD packet, and so eventlet
trampolines to Greenthread B. Now, Greenthread B also calls next() to
get a handoff node, and dies with a ValueError.

This commit wraps up concurrently-accessed iter_nodes() iterators in a
new thing called a GreenthreadSafeIterator that serializes access.

Bug 1180110
Change-Id: I8fe13d7295c056a2cab9e084f5966078a49bdc13
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ValueError from handoff logging.

If you have StatsD logging turned on, then the iterator returned by
Ring.get_part_nodes() will emit StatsD packets when it yields a
handoff node. That network IO may make eventlet trampoline to another
greenthread before returning from next(). Now, if that other
greenthread tries to call next() on that same iterator, it blows up
with a ValueError.

Any socket IO inside a generator's next() method can cause this. It's
easiest to reproduce with StatsD logging turned on, but logging to
syslog can trigger it too.

You can see this happen sometimes in the proxy's make_requests method
if two of the primary nodes are down. Greenthread A goes into next()
to get a handoff node, then sends a StatsD packet, and so eventlet
trampolines to Greenthread B. Now, Greenthread B also calls next() to
get a handoff node, and dies with a ValueError.

This commit wraps up concurrently-accessed iter_nodes() iterators in a
new thing called a GreenthreadSafeIterator that serializes access.

Bug 1180110
Change-Id: I8fe13d7295c056a2cab9e084f5966078a49bdc13

subject: make sql_connection optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-22 00:19:14.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_spec.rb'], 'message': 'make sql_connection optional

This commit sets the default to the sql_connection
class parameter from the cinder class to false so that
it is optional.

The cinder class is intended to configure settings common
to all ciner roles and sql_connection is specific to the server
side roles. This commit makes it optional, so that nodes configured
only as volumes do not have to set sql_connections.

Change-Id: Id20dcc68779b2bb3bfb67fdc5b0862d0c86aa7b0
'}]
commit_message:
make sql_connection optional

This commit sets the default to the sql_connection
class parameter from the cinder class to false so that
it is optional.

The cinder class is intended to configure settings common
to all ciner roles and sql_connection is specific to the server
side roles. This commit makes it optional, so that nodes configured
only as volumes do not have to set sql_connections.

Change-Id: Id20dcc68779b2bb3bfb67fdc5b0862d0c86aa7b0

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-05-18 07:15:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/views.py', 'horizon/templatetags/sizeformat.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/update_instance.py', 'horizon/decorators.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/cinder.py', 'horizon/workflows/base.py', 'horizon/conf/default.py', 'horizon/templatetags/horizon.py', 'openstack_dashboard/usage/base.py', 'horizon/base.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/settings/user/forms.py', 'horizon/exceptions.py', 'horizon/utils/fields.py', 'horizon/templatetags/branding.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/api_access/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/tabs.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/overview/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py'], 'message': 'Use ugettext_lazy instead of ugettext.

We should use ugettext_lazy to let users in different languages
get correct translation.Though in views or similar places
we can use ugettext with no problems, we should make code
style consistent.

This also fix the issues that the django proxy objects appear on the
launching instance page instead of translated strings. Now the
translated quota strings are handled correctly.

Fixes: bug #1178722

Change-Id: I76f0d31e6546d70e5ece7e86a06f7eefd04861d2
'}]
commit_message:
Use ugettext_lazy instead of ugettext.

We should use ugettext_lazy to let users in different languages
get correct translation.Though in views or similar places
we can use ugettext with no problems, we should make code
style consistent.

This also fix the issues that the django proxy objects appear on the
launching instance page instead of translated strings. Now the
translated quota strings are handled correctly.

Fixes: bug #1178722

Change-Id: I76f0d31e6546d70e5ece7e86a06f7eefd04861d2

commit_message:
Add ImageNotActive check for instance rebuild

We have a check in place on create to test whether the image is marked
as deleted in Glance that doesn't exist on the rebuild method. This
patch adds that check and tests, with a follow-on patch forthcoming to
refactor the code to a shared method.

Fixes bug 1180604

Change-Id: I1e75313a72d2197e83f7dacf6bcbd6750dd490cd

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-21 01:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Add notification for live migration

Fix bug 1167759

Currently, if live migration failed, nova compute did not send
notification, this causes other services such as nova-scheduler
to have no chance to do some operations

The fix add notification logic for live_migration like other
VM instance operations such as resize, run instance etc.

Change-Id: Iaf61f5268e07284fd7d69ff331ce3bacd380c02b
'}]
commit_message:
Add notification for live migration

Fix bug 1167759

Currently, if live migration failed, nova compute did not send
notification, this causes other services such as nova-scheduler
to have no chance to do some operations

The fix add notification logic for live_migration like other
VM instance operations such as resize, run instance etc.

Change-Id: Iaf61f5268e07284fd7d69ff331ce3bacd380c02b

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2835, 'name': 'Brian Elliott', 'email': 'bdelliott@gmail.com', 'username': 'belliott'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-21 00:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pip-requires'], 'message': "Add requests requirement capped <1.2.1.

Fixes bug 1182271.

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work.
Because requests is actually a dependency of python-cinderclient but
is only breaking nova's unit tests, it has to be added and come
before python-cinderclient in the pip-requires list. A separate
change has been proposed to openstack/requirements which will need
to merge first. https://review.openstack.org/29850

Change-Id: Ia198192d6231f71272d3aa4f5942828a45d86ceb
"}]
commit_message:
Add requests requirement capped <1.2.1.

Fixes bug 1182271.

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work.
Because requests is actually a dependency of python-cinderclient but
is only breaking nova's unit tests, it has to be added and come
before python-cinderclient in the pip-requires list. A separate
change has been proposed to openstack/requirements which will need
to merge first. https://review.openstack.org/29850

Change-Id: Ia198192d6231f71272d3aa4f5942828a45d86ceb

subject: Minor changes to quantum::agents::ovs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-21 19:56:22.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/agents/ovs.pp', 'spec/classes/quantum_agents_ovs_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Minor changes to quantum::agents::ovs

This patch contains two minor edits to the
quantum::agents::ovs code.

1. allow setting of the firewall_driver.

This code ensures that the firewall driver can be
either set to its default of IptablesFirewallDriver
or unset (which we believe is required in the case
of compute nodes with gre enabled)

2. explicitly remove tunneling configuration when
it is not being used. This is part of an ongoing
attempt to clean up configuration that are not
currently in use.

This patch also adds tests to verify the proposed
code.

Change-Id: I372889d1c8821605d60c91c1e244d1a4c83fcc5e
'}]
commit_message:
Minor changes to quantum::agents::ovs

This patch contains two minor edits to the
quantum::agents::ovs code.

1. allow setting of the firewall_driver.

This code ensures that the firewall driver can be
either set to its default of IptablesFirewallDriver
or unset (which we believe is required in the case
of compute nodes with gre enabled)

2. explicitly remove tunneling configuration when
it is not being used. This is part of an ongoing
attempt to clean up configuration that are not
currently in use.

This patch also adds tests to verify the proposed
code.

Change-Id: I372889d1c8821605d60c91c1e244d1a4c83fcc5e

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work. A
corresponding patch is being drafted for nova, bug 1182271.

Change-Id: I2ea71d2bbc8a4e67a4c07672aadef218330641da

commit_message:
Cap requests <1.2.1.

* tools/pip-requires: The requests library released 1.2.1 today
which brings in sphinx as a new dependency. One of sphinx's
transitive dependencies is on a newer version of jinja than is
provided in the python-jinja2 package on CentOS 6, and since nova's
unit tests allow site-packages in the venv for libvirt support this
cap is needed so that gate-nova-python26 will continue to work. A
corresponding patch is being drafted for nova, bug 1182271.

Change-Id: I2ea71d2bbc8a4e67a4c07672aadef218330641da

commit_message:
Pass memcache_servers as array

the python-memcached module expects memcache_servers to be an
array of strings or an array of tuples. Since we don't care about
server weighting, we can use an array of tuples for the unit test.

Fixes bug 1172723

Change-Id: Iafba2bda545ea334d5aba7135e153d8589612ba4

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-05-20 16:04:05.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/images.py', 'tests/v1/test_images.py'], 'message': 'Convert non-ascii characters within image property to unicode

Convert non-ascii characters within image property (key/value pair) to
unicode but utf-8 to prevent provisioning failure when cloud using qpid
backend.
This change also make the image property encoding consistency between
the image updating and the receiving. Before this, image property
updating use unicode, but receiving (get) result is utf-8.

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I010760c598a7e008c79f1240255708265352cdb5
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Convert non-ascii characters within image property to unicode

Convert non-ascii characters within image property (key/value pair) to
unicode but utf-8 to prevent provisioning failure when cloud using qpid
backend.
This change also make the image property encoding consistency between
the image updating and the receiving. Before this, image property
updating use unicode, but receiving (get) result is utf-8.

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I010760c598a7e008c79f1240255708265352cdb5
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:

commit_message:

Empty string is a perfectly valid raw string and the default type is

subject: Building the image using dib no longer ignores the base element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-21 17:04:37.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/functions_qemu'], 'message': 'Building the image using dib no longer ignores the base element

When we build our image using dib, we should no longer use the -n flag which
suppresses the base element. With this fix, our first-boot.d script is now
being run on boot and the guest agent is installed successfully.

Fixes bug: 1182269

Change-Id: Ibdeb1f19b7b3e19e5709051251cdba1a99eda588
'}]
commit_message:
Building the image using dib no longer ignores the base element

When we build our image using dib, we should no longer use the -n flag which
suppresses the base element. With this fix, our first-boot.d script is now
being run on boot and the guest agent is installed successfully.

Fixes bug: 1182269

Change-Id: Ibdeb1f19b7b3e19e5709051251cdba1a99eda588

commit_message:
Add generic serialization support

This adds a generic serialization model that the RpcProxy and
RpcDispatcher will use to serialize and deserialize arguments
and return values. The base definition is provided, as well
as a default NoOpSerializer which performs no special
action (retaining the existing behavior).

Related to blueprint rpc-object-serialization

Change-Id: I0a33baddee3e28dfc47100eb3216b679558b0bdd

subject: Pass quantum admin credentials when setting up client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-16 16:35:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/quantumv2/__init__.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_quantumv2.py'], 'message': 'Pass quantum admin credentials when setting up client

This patch fixes a race condition where the user gets a token, uses it
to delete an instance, and immediately deletes the token before 
quantum can use it to clean up the network associated with the 
instance. Note that in this scenario the user is not waiting for the 
instance to be completely deleted before deleting the token that is 
passed to quantum.

Fixes bug 1177579

Change-Id: I3fe369402cbb0bc38ff3e528ba0eb0e7189cd66f
'}]
commit_message:
Pass quantum admin credentials when setting up client

This patch fixes a race condition where the user gets a token, uses it
to delete an instance, and immediately deletes the token before 
quantum can use it to clean up the network associated with the 
instance. Note that in this scenario the user is not waiting for the 
instance to be completely deleted before deleting the token that is 
passed to quantum.

Fixes bug 1177579

Change-Id: I3fe369402cbb0bc38ff3e528ba0eb0e7189cd66f

commit_message:
Allow suppression of v1 API.

Fixes bug 1180567

The v1 API is on the deprecation path, so should not require
that distros have all its dependencies available.

Thus we add a new configuration option to allow the v1 app
creation to be suppressed.

Change-Id: Ib5af241a57f54754be534c9acb92a377362571e3

commit_message:
Makes error message consistent with volume-attach

The patch for bug-1166770 hid the real exceptions raised by
check_attach. This patch fixes it so that more meaningful
exception messages can be given to the user and that they are
consistent with the volume-attach error messages

subject: Fallback to publicURL if adminURL is not found.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1038, 'name': 'Jack McCann', 'username': 'jack-mccann'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-05-21 14:54:27.000000000', 'files': ['quantumclient/common/exceptions.py', 'tests/unit/test_auth.py', 'quantumclient/client.py'], 'message': "Fallback to publicURL if adminURL is not found.

This change falls back on publicURL if the adminURL is not found in
the service catalog.  This change maintains the historic default
behavior of using 'adminURL' if it is there.

Also, adds a new exception type to handle the case where a suitable
endpoint type is not found in the catalog.  Without this, the
exception encountered is a KeyError that is not accurately reported to
the caller of the quantum command line.

Added unit tests for the url_for method of the Service Catalog which
trigger the problem with the previous code base and pass with this
proposed fix.

Fixes: Bug #1123383
Change-Id: If89fde3c80ad1858333395462ac9a6855618a499
"}]
commit_message:
Fallback to publicURL if adminURL is not found.

This change falls back on publicURL if the adminURL is not found in
the service catalog.  This change maintains the historic default
behavior of using 'adminURL' if it is there.

Also, adds a new exception type to handle the case where a suitable
endpoint type is not found in the catalog.  Without this, the
exception encountered is a KeyError that is not accurately reported to
the caller of the quantum command line.

Added unit tests for the url_for method of the Service Catalog which
trigger the problem with the previous code base and pass with this
proposed fix.

Fixes: Bug #1123383
Change-Id: If89fde3c80ad1858333395462ac9a6855618a499

commit_message:
Update security_group_api param

The security_group_api value now should either be nova or quantum depending
if one is using nova security groups or quantum security groups. When set to
quantum all nova security group api requests are proxied to quantum.

Change-Id: Ib619ac3ce8face0cea59f9de145562bd6e8e1762

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-20 15:10:15.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/transport/wsgi/exceptions.py', 'marconi/transport/wsgi/helpers.py', 'marconi/transport/wsgi/queues.py', 'marconi/transport/helpers.py', 'marconi/tests/transport/wsgi/test_helpers.py', 'marconi/transport/wsgi/messages.py', 'marconi/transport/wsgi/claims.py'], 'message': 'Clean up exception handling in the WSGI transport driver.

This patch localizes try...except blocks, DRYs construction of
certain HTTP exceptions, and modifies what types of exceptions
are thrown (in some cases), to be more precise.

I also factored out some input validation code that happened
to be mixed up with all the exception handling.

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: I1030308bed1ec55477b176bf022118d53b46b7ff
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up exception handling in the WSGI transport driver.

This patch localizes try...except blocks, DRYs construction of
certain HTTP exceptions, and modifies what types of exceptions
are thrown (in some cases), to be more precise.

I also factored out some input validation code that happened
to be mixed up with all the exception handling.

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: I1030308bed1ec55477b176bf022118d53b46b7ff

commit_message:
rename tests -> api

Now that all the other tests are moved out of the tests directory
we can rename tests -> api to reflect that these tests are api
testing, and need to use only the internal clients.

Clean up references from other parts of OpenStack to the new api
namespace.

Reorder the imports as required with this naming change.

Added README.rst

Change-Id: I19203957f917b59e7c8a3838c590937752461a2f

commit_message:
tests : add explicit dependency on cinderclient 1.0.4

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28054/ introduces a test requirement
for the latest python-cinderclient, attempting to run with 1.0.3 results
in test_volume failing.  In due course we should probably fix test_volume
so it actually fakes the client instead of having this dependency

commit_message:
Run the dnspython dependency back.

The initial dnspython dependency was probably a bit aggressive.  Ubuntu
Oneiric and Precise both packaged 1.9.4 and there's not too much in the
package changelog to recommend 1.10.0 over 1.9.4, at least not for a
requirement.

subject: Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-04-29 18:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_floating_ips.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py'], 'message': 'Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip

Fixes bug #1172599
reproduce steps:
1. create an instance
2. get a floating ip from pool
3. associate the ip to instance created at step 1
4. delete the instance and the ip at a very little interval

reason may be that:
1. the action of delete ip find the ip is associated to a fixed ip at
   first(at api level)
2. and then the fixed ip is released when the instance is deleted
3. so nova-network manager findes this issue and raises
   exception.FloatingIpNotAssociated(address=floating_address)

Change-Id: I253d0b240451e8a728532639e9857894f6fc6870
(cherry picked from commit a5923541e990326a9b850926e74026d5947ae142)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip

Fixes bug #1172599
reproduce steps:
1. create an instance
2. get a floating ip from pool
3. associate the ip to instance created at step 1
4. delete the instance and the ip at a very little interval

reason may be that:
1. the action of delete ip find the ip is associated to a fixed ip at
   first(at api level)
2. and then the fixed ip is released when the instance is deleted
3. so nova-network manager findes this issue and raises
   exception.FloatingIpNotAssociated(address=floating_address)

Change-Id: I253d0b240451e8a728532639e9857894f6fc6870
(cherry picked from commit a5923541e990326a9b850926e74026d5947ae142)

subject: xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-02 19:06:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/host.py'], 'message': "xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception

The existing code would catch a missing SR exception and bail out of the
`update_status` method before finishing, causing required keys to be missing.
The end-result was code breaking later on when it tried to access these keys.

Since an SR is required to generate these required stats keys, we shouldn't
swallow the StorageRepositoryNotFound exception and instead should fail-fast.

Fixes bug 1175357

Change-Id: I3d65ae807fb2d86277bc0061c1967a87792b6662
(cherry picked from commit b6aac988e46147154d49e938ecf9b67831613636)
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception

The existing code would catch a missing SR exception and bail out of the
`update_status` method before finishing, causing required keys to be missing.
The end-result was code breaking later on when it tried to access these keys.

Since an SR is required to generate these required stats keys, we shouldn't
swallow the StorageRepositoryNotFound exception and instead should fail-fast.

Fixes bug 1175357

Change-Id: I3d65ae807fb2d86277bc0061c1967a87792b6662
(cherry picked from commit b6aac988e46147154d49e938ecf9b67831613636)

commit_message:
Replace nose with testr

- add .testr.conf (in base dir and nova_tests)
- remove all references to nose
- adjust paths: A couple of tests would assume the current directory
  was ./tests/ but it is now ./
- don't run the tests in parallel as the db tests have one connection
  per test class.

nova_tests hackery:
It seems testtools/testr imports everything and I just don't see a way of
running things in tests/ and nova_tests/ seperately but in one .test.conf.
So if you want to use testr directly you will need to:
 testr run
 cd nova_tests
 testr run

part of bug 1177924
Change-Id: I41875dcf94463fa5f9c07a7840c37089226c59ad

commit_message:
Use fixtures in the tests

TempDir() makes sure all files created under it are deleted
at the end of the tests.
FakeLogger() hides logs when the test passes and displays logs
for failed tests.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-16 14:45:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix cinder always converts raw images even if they are already raw

During the creation process of the command "cinder create --image-id"
cinder tries to convert the image no matter what the orign format is.
Thus the process can be speed up by simply checking if the image already
has the good format, if so we don't run the qemu-img command.

Change-Id: Ie683735c3dede9944bd5d41c729596b04b72c17d
Fixes: bug #1180831
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder always converts raw images even if they are already raw

During the creation process of the command "cinder create --image-id"
cinder tries to convert the image no matter what the orign format is.
Thus the process can be speed up by simply checking if the image already
has the good format, if so we don't run the qemu-img command.

Change-Id: Ie683735c3dede9944bd5d41c729596b04b72c17d
Fixes: bug #1180831

commit_message:
engine : cleanup Resource.update error paths

The current update code uses a nasty pattern where returning an
arbitrary string from Resource.update is interpreted in parser.Stack
as an error.  Instead use exceptions which is much nicer :)

Change-Id: I2ddebfd6bbec3dc229012406da72dd928fcc4595

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.

Change-Id: Iccab055c4664e11c9618706e594416194065048b
"}]
commit_message:
Reference DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE OptGoup names in lowercase

To have consistent option group name format across projects,
oslo.config now normalizes all non lowercase group names to lowercase
when loading conf files.
Thus conf files are backwards compatible but option group references
in the code must now use lowercase before we update oslo.config.

This patch replaces all 'DEFAULT_SERVICETYPE' references to
'default_servicetype'

Change-Id: Iccab055c4664e11c9618706e594416194065048b

commit_message:
Make logging level in unit tests configurable.

Added a debug option to unittest(BaseTestCase) which sets logging level of
fixtures.FakeLogger to DEBUG. To enable this option, set OS_DEBUG=True or
OS_DEBUG=1 in environment variables.

Fixes: bug #1181925
Change-Id: Id09008ddabb837290edf12e1cbd014dc74760113

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-20 22:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/rpc/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/proxy.py'], 'message': 'Allow RPC_API_NAMESPACE on RpcProxy objects

This allows one to subclass RpcProxy for use with a particular

make_namespaced_msg() method.  This new RPC_API_NAMESPACE attribute will

Change-Id: Ied62df839cda0be6f9f9b060bbfc22e086f61be8

commit_message:
Allow RPC_API_NAMESPACE on RpcProxy objects

This allows one to subclass RpcProxy for use with a particular
namespace without having to repeatedly pass the namespace into the
make_namespaced_msg() method.  This new RPC_API_NAMESPACE attribute will
be used for the make_msg() call.  It is defaulted to None to match previous
behavior.

Change-Id: Ied62df839cda0be6f9f9b060bbfc22e086f61be8

subject: Cleanup nova subcommands for security groups and rules
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-18 12:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['tests/v1_1/test_security_group_rules.py', 'tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/security_group_rules.py'], 'message': "Cleanup nova subcommands for security groups and rules

The Changes include:
  - Sanity check for from_port, to_port, and IP protocol when adding
    a security rule
  - Print one more column 'Id' for security groups
  - If there are multiple security groups with the same name, the group
    can't be deleted unless an ID is specified. However, there is no code
    to search and delete security group by ID. So, _get_secgroup() will
    get group by ID if the input is like a UUID. If not found, then get
    group by name.
  - Some corresponding changes for help messages.
  - Test case changes after adding sanity check.

Change-Id: Ibd82d8404bdd64e4bca2f8b25756bfaff7b28194
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup nova subcommands for security groups and rules

The Changes include:
  - Sanity check for from_port, to_port, and IP protocol when adding
    a security rule
  - Print one more column 'Id' for security groups
  - If there are multiple security groups with the same name, the group
    can't be deleted unless an ID is specified. However, there is no code
    to search and delete security group by ID. So, _get_secgroup() will
    get group by ID if the input is like a UUID. If not found, then get
    group by name.
  - Some corresponding changes for help messages.
  - Test case changes after adding sanity check.

Change-Id: Ibd82d8404bdd64e4bca2f8b25756bfaff7b28194
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Create quantum networks for server tests.

Allows compute tests to utilize the quantumclient to create
required networks for the randomly generated tenants used in the
compute.servers tests.

Update: * pep8 fix.
        * Skip tests if quantum available with no tenant
          credentials.
        * Create and raise net/subnet creation exceptions.

Fixes: (LP: #1092009)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1038, 'name': 'Jack McCann', 'username': 'jack-mccann'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-05-21 06:13:49.000000000', 'files': ['quantumclient/v2_0/client.py', 'quantumclient/common/exceptions.py', 'quantumclient/shell.py', 'tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'tests/unit/test_auth.py', 'quantumclient/client.py', 'quantumclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Allow the HTTPClient consumer to pass endpoint_type.

Changes the default behavior of the client.  It will now choose
publicURL by default rather than adminURL.

Now allows the consumer to pass adminURL, internalURL or some other
endpoint type when constructing a Client to override this default
behavior.

Adds --endpoint-type option to the shell client.  Defaults to the
environment variable OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE or publicURL.  This was
patterned after the same option in the Nova client.

Adds a new exception type to handle the case where a suitable endpoint
type is not found in the catalog.  Without this, the exception
encountered is a KeyError that was not clearly reported to the caller
of the quantum command line.

Change-Id: Iaffcaff291d433a605d8379dc89c1308096d36c2
Fixes: Bug #1176197
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the HTTPClient consumer to pass endpoint_type.

Changes the default behavior of the client.  It will now choose
publicURL by default rather than adminURL.

Now allows the consumer to pass adminURL, internalURL or some other
endpoint type when constructing a Client to override this default
behavior.

Adds --endpoint-type option to the shell client.  Defaults to the
environment variable OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE or publicURL.  This was
patterned after the same option in the Nova client.

Adds a new exception type to handle the case where a suitable endpoint
type is not found in the catalog.  Without this, the exception
encountered is a KeyError that was not clearly reported to the caller
of the quantum command line.

Change-Id: Iaffcaff291d433a605d8379dc89c1308096d36c2
Fixes: Bug #1176197

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 14:12:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/netutils.py'], 'message': 'Being more defensive around the use_ipv6 config option

fixes bug 1175725

Will allow for the flag to be set to filter out ipv6 if
configured but will not add ipv6 to template if ipv6 is not
configured in quantum. This will allow spwan to continue
working in the case where ipv6 is not configured but flag
use_ipv6 is set in nova.

Change-Id: I26ebdff81efcdeff827521cec247d2c443a5e0ad
(cherry picked from commit 005b9950ac84bf3ae06c24ee018f192064060428)
'}]
commit_message:
Being more defensive around the use_ipv6 config option

fixes bug 1175725

Will allow for the flag to be set to filter out ipv6 if
configured but will not add ipv6 to template if ipv6 is not
configured in quantum. This will allow spwan to continue
working in the case where ipv6 is not configured but flag
use_ipv6 is set in nova.

Change-Id: I26ebdff81efcdeff827521cec247d2c443a5e0ad
(cherry picked from commit 005b9950ac84bf3ae06c24ee018f192064060428)

commit_message:
Fix a deleted flavor still could be shown

This commit fix 2 problems, 1. A deleted flavor still show
2. 'flavor-show' a new flavor which id use previous deleted
flavor id will show the deleted flavor information.

Change-Id: I9586009af76fbf716c3a3f4c126ace47ea9094eb
Fixes: bug 1168260
Depends On: I143903cb

commit_message:
UpdateStack for AWS::AutoScaling::ScalingPolicy

Implemented update support of the ScalingPolicy resource
in an existing stack. ScalingAdjustment, AdjustmentType,
and Cooldown properties are allowed properties for update.
A handle_update method is added to update differences in
the template.

Change-Id: Ieeae93560a315a8a35c6fb2d8f1d78a89123bec3
blueprint: scalingpolicy-update-stack

revisions:

Adds root user check to determine whether or not sudo is required
for MySQL status and installation.  We now run sudo -l to verify

bug 1181701

Change-Id: I294b269046ee2049b0fdee3c871096387cefbf24

commit_message:
Adds sudo check for privileged operations.

Adds root user check to determine whether or not sudo is required
for MySQL status and installation.  We now run sudo -l to verify
that the user is in the sudoers file, the credentials are then
cached for the rest of the operations.

bug 1181701

Change-Id: I294b269046ee2049b0fdee3c871096387cefbf24

commit_message:
engine : remove unused update states/status

We have some aws-isms in the update code related to different
update states, which is not actually used anywhere, so may as
well remove it - it's probably easier at least for now to focus
on the three update states of COMPLETE/FAILED/REPLACEMENT

Change-Id: Ieeaf92ab0fec6bbfab3dddf2d8fecb0b38c1b2fc

subject: Swap the order of baremetal partitions.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-10 21:00:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/baremetal_deploy_helper.py'], 'message': 'Swap the order of baremetal partitions.

Automatically growing the root partition via cloud-init depends on there being
empty space after the partition in the partition table. The current layout has
no such space. We could either put the swap partition at the end of the disk
rather than just after the root partition, or we can switch the order of the
partitions. Neither seems intrinsically better so I have opted for the smallest
code change.

Fixes bug 1178118.

Change-Id: I3b0688a24e284f3d3bd890a09ff3cf3ebf76877b
'}]
commit_message:
Swap the order of baremetal partitions.

Automatically growing the root partition via cloud-init depends on there being
empty space after the partition in the partition table. The current layout has
no such space. We could either put the swap partition at the end of the disk
rather than just after the root partition, or we can switch the order of the
partitions. Neither seems intrinsically better so I have opted for the smallest
code change.

Fixes bug 1178118.

Change-Id: I3b0688a24e284f3d3bd890a09ff3cf3ebf76877b

subject: Add respawn limit to prevent infinite respawn.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-21 02:41:24.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-daemon'], 'message': 'Add respawn limit to prevent infinite respawn.

The respawn count is not incremented until post-start exits, so we
need to set the count lower than the interval to allow for the lag
caused by the one second sleep. Two times in 5 seconds seems like
enough to handle the occasional unexpected crash but stay dead when
things are badly broken.

Change-Id: I8eaca6f9ea131861a42d473ffc5c09a41226ce0e
'}]
commit_message:
Add respawn limit to prevent infinite respawn.

The respawn count is not incremented until post-start exits, so we
need to set the count lower than the interval to allow for the lag
caused by the one second sleep. Two times in 5 seconds seems like
enough to handle the occasional unexpected crash but stay dead when
things are badly broken.

Change-Id: I8eaca6f9ea131861a42d473ffc5c09a41226ce0e

commit_message:
Set TZ environment variable to avoid a stat call

By setting the TZ environment variable for the WSGI process we avoid
the stat("/etc/localtime") on every request handled that logs using
strftime().

Change-Id: Ifc78236a99ed193a42389e383d062b38f57a5a31
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
